decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent using cheap spells and creatures with prowess abilities. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Emberheart Challenger, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Reckless Rage and Stormchaser's Talent allows for removal and additional damage when needed. The deck also includes a mix of burn spells and creatures with evasion to keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck is designed to be fast, flexible, and hard-hitting.

The deck focuses on using low-cost aggressive spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage benefit from castings spells, while cards like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage efficiently remove opposing threats. Riverpyre Verge and Stormchaser's Talent provide card advantage and extra damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and maintain pressure throughout the game, leveraging the synergy between cheap spells, spellborne creatures, and supplementary effects.

The main concept of this deck is to focus on utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures and spells, along with synergistic support cards like Steam Vents, Spirebluff Canal, and Shivan Reef, to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal massive damage. Cards like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger are integral in maintaining a high pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics, along with powerful removal options like Reckless Rage and Burst Lightning to control the board and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent through a combination of cheap spells and creatures with prowess abilities. By playing efficient threats like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, backed up by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics also provide flexibility and disruption, allowing the deck to maintain tempo and outmaneuver opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence and pressuring the opponent with aggressive creatures like Badgermole Cub and Aven Interrupter. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Elvish Mystic, the deck aims to quickly ramp up and overpower the opponent. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition provide disruption to the opponent's game plan, while Elspeth, Storm Slayer offers a powerful finisher. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, enabling the deck to consistently apply pressure and close out games efficiently.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to deploy efficient and aggressive creatures early on to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes mana acceleration from cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to cast powerful creatures such as Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben also disrupts opponent's game plan while Collected Company provides card advantage and helps in finding key creatures. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and pressure the opponent with a mix of disruption and aggression.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent by playing low-cost, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while using burn spells like Fiery Impulse to control the board. The deck aims to maintain tempo and outpace the opponent by leveraging the prowess mechanic and utilizing cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Experimental Synthesizer to maintain card advantage. By focusing on a fast and aggressive playstyle, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent before they are able to stabilize and mount a defense.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure to the opponent early on. It also utilizes burn spells like Reckless Rage and Fiery Impulse to remove threats and clear the way for its creatures to attack. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan, backed up by versatile cards like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to provide additional card advantage and utility. The key strategy is to maintain a steady stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on a combo strategy that utilizes cards that synergize well together to create powerful sequences and overwhelming advantages. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through efficient removal spells and card advantage engines. The deck utilizes a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that work together seamlessly to generate value and pressure the opponent. By combining various elements of the deck effectively, the player can outmaneuver their opponent and secure a victory through clever plays and tactical decisions.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and aggressive creatures to overwhelm your opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Lady Octopus provide card advantage and recursion, while Cori-Steel Cutter and Gran-Gran deal damage quickly. Experimental Synthesizer and Pinnacle Emissary help ramp up your board presence, while Metallic Rebuke offers disruption. The inclusion of equipment like Lavaspur Boots and Shadowspear enhances your creature's abilities. Overall, this deck aims to establish a fast and powerful presence on the battlefield, using a mix of artifacts and creatures to dominate the game.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes and then use cheap spells and card draw to bring them back onto the battlefield for repetitive, aggressive attacks. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures, efficient removal, and card advantage from spells like Consider and Treasure Cruise. The deck also includes cards like Sleight of Hand and Opt to help ensure consistent draws and maximize the chances of bringing back Arclight Phoenix.

This deck focuses on controlling the game while simultaneously ramping up mana with Omnath, Locus of Creation and other powerful ramp cards. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with big spells and creatures, utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value. The deck includes a variety of lands to ensure mana consistency and powerful spells like Nissa, Resurgent Animist and Culling Ritual to maintain control over the game. Overall, the deck combines elements of control and ramp to dominate the battlefield and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly developing your board presence with low-cost creatures such as Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, while disrupting your opponent with cards like Skyclave Apparition and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Collected Company allows you to dig for more creatures and refill your board after removal. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, Selesnya Aggro aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and maintain pressure to secure a swift victory. The deck also includes some powerful finishers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Archon of Emeria to close out the game if needed.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cheap spells and then using cards like Arclight Phoenix and Picklock Prankster to put pressure on the opponent. By efficiently casting spells like Lightning Axe, Fiery Impulse, and Treasure Cruise, you can trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability and bring them back from the graveyard. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and aggressive, constantly putting your opponent on the back foot and overwhelming them with a flurry of spells and creatures.

Control the game using counterspells, removal, and card draw to outvalue your opponent. Use Kaheera as a companion to provide additional value. Utilize lands like Hallowed Fountain and Floodfarm Verge to ensure you hit your mana drops. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer provide additional win conditions. March of Otherworldly Light and Restless Anchorage help you control the board. Overall, this deck is focused on controlling the game through a combination of removal, counterspells, and card advantage to outlast and outvalue your opponent in a slower, grindy matchup.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence with early aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, supported by burn spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower to clear the way for attacks. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with spells like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics. The inclusion of cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Stormchaser's Talent help with maintaining card advantage and supporting aggressive plays.
